conclusion: Need to find acceleration from v-t graph during 1 to 3 seconds.
Slope of v-t graph represents acceleration.
Acceleration is constant as graph is a straight line from 1 to 3 seconds.
Identify points: t = 1 second, velocity = 2 m/s.
Identify points: t = 3 seconds, velocity = -2 m/s.
Acceleration a = Δv / Δt = -4 m/s / 2 s = -2 m/s².
Negative sign indicates acceleration is opposite to initial motion.
Velocity decreases and changes direction, confirming negative acceleration.
Graph is a straight line from t = 1 to t = 3 seconds.
Units of acceleration should be m/s².
Area under v-t graph gives displacement, not relevant for acceleration.
From t = 0 to t = 1 second, acceleration is zero.
From t = 1 to t = 3 seconds, acceleration is -2 m/s².
